entry.title: C++çš„Signalä½¿ç”¨
entry.content:
C++ Signalä½¿ç”¨

ç®€ä»‹
ä¿¡å·æœºåˆ¶æ˜¯è¿›ç¨‹ä¹‹é—´ç›¸äº’ä¼ é€’æ¶ˆæ¯çš„ä¸€ç§æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œä¿¡å·å…¨ç§°ä¸ºè½¯ä¸­æ–­ä¿¡å·ï¼Œä¹Ÿæœ‰äººç§°è½¯ä¸­æ–­ã€‚ä»å®ƒçš„å‘½åå¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡ºï¼Œå®ƒçš„å®è´¨å’Œä½¿ç”¨å¾ˆåƒä¸­æ–­ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰ï¼Œä¿¡å·å¯ä»¥è¯´æ˜¯è¿›ç¨‹æ§åˆ¶çš„ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†ã€‚ä¿¡å·signalå¤„ç†æ˜¯Linuxç¨‹åºçš„ä¸€ä¸ªç‰¹è‰²ï¼Œç”¨ä¿¡å·å¤„ç†æ¥æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿçš„ä¸­æ–­åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚C++ä½¿ç”¨å¤„ç†ä¿¡å·çš„æ ‡å‡†åº“ #include <csignal> æˆ– #include <signal.h>

1.ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯ä¿¡å·

  • #include <csignal> æˆ– #include <signal.h>æ˜¯å¤„ç†ä¿¡å·çš„Cæ ‡å‡†åº“ï¼Œè¯¥åº“ä¸»è¦åŒ…å«äº†signal()ä¸raise()ä¸¤ä¸ªåŠŸèƒ½å‡½æ•°ã€‚

    1. å‡½æ•°signalç”¨äºæ•è·ä¿¡å·ï¼Œå¯æŒ‡å®šä¿¡å·å¤„ç†çš„æ–¹å¼ã€‚
    2. å‡½æ•°raiseäº§ç”Ÿä¸€ä¸ªä¿¡å·ï¼Œå¹¶å‘å½“å‰æ­£åœ¨æ‰§è¡Œçš„ç¨‹åºå‘é€è¯¥ä¿¡å·ã€‚

  • ä¿¡å·signalå¯ä»¥ç†è§£ä¸ºç”±æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿä¼ ç»™ç¨‹åºï¼ˆè¿›ç¨‹ï¼‰çš„äº‹ä»¶ï¼Œåªæ˜¯ç”¨æ¥é€šçŸ¥ç¨‹åºå‘ç”Ÿäº†ä»€ä¹ˆäº‹ä»¶ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸ä¼šä¼ é€’ç»™è¯¥è¿›ç¨‹ä»»ä½•æ•°æ®ã€‚

  • ä¿¡å·æ˜¯ä¸€ç§ä¸­æ–­ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå®ƒå¯ä»¥æ”¹å˜ç¨‹åºçš„æµç¨‹ã€‚å½“ä¿¡å·ä¼ é€’ç»™è¿›ç¨‹æ—¶ï¼Œè¿›ç¨‹å°†åœä¸‹å…¶æ­£åœ¨æ‰§è¡Œçš„æ“ä½œï¼Œå¹¶å»å¤„ç†æˆ–å¿½ç•¥è¯¥ä¿¡å·å¼‚æ­¥äº‹ä»¶ã€‚

å¼‚æ­¥äº‹ä»¶ - æŸ¥çœ‹ä¿¡å·çš„æ–¹å¼æ˜¯ä¸€ç§å¤„ç†å¼‚æ­¥äº‹ä»¶çš„æœºåˆ¶ã€‚

  • å½“ç¨‹åºé€šè¿‡signalå‡½æ•°æ•è·ä¿¡å·åï¼Œè‹¥signalå‡½æ•°ç¬¬äºŒå‚æ•°ä¸ºå‡½æ•°æŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œåˆ™è°ƒç”¨signalå‡½æ•°çš„ç¨‹åºä¼šé˜»å¡ï¼ˆæš‚åœåœ¨signalå‡½æ•°è¿™å¥ï¼‰ï¼Œç›´è‡³å¼‚æ­¥çº¿ç¨‹ï¼ˆè¿›å…¥å‡½æ•°æŒ‡é’ˆï¼‰returnã€‚ç¨‹åºå°†ä»æš‚åœç‚¹æ¢å¤æ‰§è¡Œã€‚
  • æ­¤å¤–ï¼Œè¿›ç¨‹ä¹‹é—´å¯ä»¥äº’ç›¸é€šè¿‡ç³»ç»Ÿè°ƒç”¨killå‘é€è½¯ä¸­æ–­ä¿¡å·ã€‚
    (without define class style)
  • C++å¤´æ–‡ä»¶signum.hå’Œsignum-generic.hä¸­å®šä¹‰äº†ä»¥ä¸‹ä¿¡å·
    /* We define here all the signal names listed in POSIX (1003.1-2008);
   as of 1003.1-2013, no additional signals have been added by POSIX.
   We also define here signal names that historically exist in every
   real-world POSIX variant (e.g. SIGWINCH).

   Signals in the 1-15 range are defined with their historical numbers.
   For other signals, we use the BSD numbers.
   There are two unallocated signal numbers in the 1-31 range: 7 and 29.
   Signal number 0 is reserved for use as kill(pid, 0), to test whether
   a process exists without sending it a signal.  */

/* ISO C99 signals.  */
#define	SIGINT		2	/* Interactive attention signal.  */
#define	SIGILL		4	/* Illegal instruction.  */
#define	SIGABRT		6	/* Abnormal termination.  */
#define	SIGFPE		8	/* Erroneous arithmetic operation.  */
#define	SIGSEGV		11	/* Invalid access to storage.  */
#define	SIGTERM		15	/* Termination request.  */

/* Historical signals specified by POSIX. */
#define	SIGHUP		1	/* Hangup.  */
#define	SIGQUIT		3	/* Quit.  */
#define	SIGTRAP		5	/* Trace/breakpoint trap.  */
#define	SIGKILL		9	/* Killed.  */
#define SIGBUS		10	/* Bus error.  */
#define	SIGSYS		12	/* Bad system call.  */
#define	SIGPIPE		13	/* Broken pipe.  */
#define	SIGALRM		14	/* Alarm clock.  */

/* New(er) POSIX signals (1003.1-2008, 1003.1-2013).  */
#define	SIGURG		16	/* Urgent data is available at a socket.  */
#define	SIGSTOP		17	/* Stop, unblockable.  */
#define	SIGTSTP		18	/* Keyboard stop.  */
#define	SIGCONT		19	/* Continue.  */
#define	SIGCHLD		20	/* Child terminated or stopped.  */
#define	SIGTTIN		21	/* Background read from control terminal.  */
#define	SIGTTOU		22	/* Background write to control terminal.  */
#define	SIGPOLL		23	/* Pollable event occurred (System V).  */
#define	SIGXCPU		24	/* CPU time limit exceeded.  */
#define	SIGXFSZ		25	/* File size limit exceeded.  */
#define	SIGVTALRM	26	/* Virtual timer expired.  */
#define	SIGPROF		27	/* Profiling timer expired.  */
#define	SIGUSR1		30	/* User-defined signal 1.  */
#define	SIGUSR2		31	/* User-defined signal 2.  */

/* Nonstandard signals found in all modern POSIX systems
   (including both BSD and Linux).  */
#define	SIGWINCH	28	/* Window size change (4.3 BSD, Sun).  */

/* Archaic names for compatibility.  */
#define	SIGIO		SIGPOLL	/* I/O now possible (4.2 BSD).  */
#define	SIGIOT		SIGABRT	/* IOT instruction, abort() on a PDP-11.  */
#define	SIGCLD		SIGCHLD	/* Old System V name */

2.å‡½æ•°signal

å‡½æ•°signal ç”¨äºæ•è·ä¿¡å·ï¼Œå¯æŒ‡å®šä¿¡å·å¤„ç†çš„æ–¹å¼ï¼Œå‡½æ•°å£°æ˜å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

void (*signal(int sig, void (*func)(int)))(int);

ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•° sig æŒ‡æ˜äº†æ‰€è¦å¤„ç†çš„ä¿¡å·ç±»å‹ï¼Œå®ƒå¯ä»¥å–é™¤äº†SIGKILLå’ŒSIGSTOPå¤–çš„ä»»ä½•ä¸€ç§ä¿¡å·ã€‚
ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªå‚æ•°æè¿°äº†ä¸ä¿¡å·å…³è”çš„åŠ¨ä½œï¼Œä¸‹é¢å°†ä¼šå¯¹è¿™ä¸‰ä¸ªå‚æ•°è¿›è¡Œè®²è§£ã€‚

å½“ç¨‹åºæ”¶åˆ°ä¿¡å·çš„è¿›ç¨‹å¯¹å„ç§ä¿¡å·æœ‰ä¸åŒçš„å¤„ç†æ–¹æ³•ã€‚å¤„ç†æ–¹æ³•å¯ä»¥åˆ†ä¸ºä¸‰ç±»ï¼š
â€ƒ â€ƒ 1. é»˜è®¤å¤„ç†ï¼šå¯¹ä¿¡å·è¿›è¡Œè¯¥ä¿¡å·çš„ç³»ç»Ÿé»˜è®¤å¤„ç†ï¼Œç¬¬äºŒå‚æ•°ä¸º SIG_DFLã€‚
â€ƒ â€ƒ 2. å¿½ç•¥ä¿¡å·ï¼šå¿½ç•¥è¯¥ä¿¡å·ï¼Œç¬¬äºŒå‚æ•°ä¸º SIG_IGNã€‚
â€ƒ â€ƒ 3. Function handlerï¼šæŒ‡å®šå¤„ç†å‡½æ•°ï¼Œç”±è¯¥å‡½æ•°æ¥å¤„ç†ï¼Œç¬¬äºŒå‚æ•°ä¸º å‡½æ•°æŒ‡é’ˆ ã€‚
è‹¥signalå‡½æ•°ä¸­ç¬¬äºŒå‚æ•°ï¼ˆå‡½æ•°æŒ‡é’ˆï¼‰ä¸­é€šè¿‡ raiseå‘å‡ºä¸signalå‡½æ•°å¯¹åº”ä¿¡å·ç±»å‹ç›¸åŒçš„ä¿¡å·ã€‚ç¨‹åºå°†åœ¨signalå‡½æ•°è¿™æˆä¸ºæ­»å¾ªç¯ï¼Œè‡ªå·±å‘ä¿¡å·ï¼Œè‡ªå·±æ•è·ï¼Œè¿›ç¨‹æš‚åœã€‚

2.1é»˜è®¤å¤„ç†-SIG_DFL

SIG_DFL å¯¹ä¿¡å·è¿›è¡Œè¯¥ä¿¡å·çš„ç³»ç»Ÿé»˜è®¤å¤„ç†ã€‚

#include <chrono>
#include <iostream>
#include <csignal>
#include <thread>

using namespace std;
int main() {
    
    signal(SIGINT, SIG_DFL);
    while(1){
        std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::seconds(1));
        std::cout << "hello world!" << endl;
    }
    return 0;
}

è¯¥ç¨‹åºåŒ…å«ä¸€ä¸ªæ­»å¾ªç¯ï¼Œå¾ªç¯å†…ä»¥ä¸€ç§’ä¸ºé—´éš” æ‰“å°è¯­å¥ã€‚
SIGINTä¿¡å·ä»£è¡¨ç”±InterruptKeyäº§ç”Ÿï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯CTRL +C ã€‚æ‰§è¡Œä¸Šè¿°ä»£ç æ—¶ï¼ŒæŒ‰ä¸‹CTRL + C åç¨‹åºé€€å‡ºã€‚

2.2å¿½ç•¥ä¿¡å·-SIG_IGN

SIG_IGN è¡¨ç¤ºå¿½ç•¥è¯¥ä¿¡å·ã€‚

#include <chrono>
#include <iostream>
#include <csignal>
#include <thread>

using namespace std;
int main() {
    
    signal(SIGINT, SIG_IGN);
    while(1){
        std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::seconds(1));
        std::cout << "hello world!" << endl;
    }
    return 0;
}

è¯¥ç¨‹åºåŒ…å«ä¸€ä¸ªæ­»å¾ªç¯ï¼Œå¾ªç¯å†…ä»¥ä¸€ç§’ä¸ºé—´éš” æ‰“å°è¯­å¥ã€‚
SIGINTä¿¡å·ä»£è¡¨ç”±InterruptKeyäº§ç”Ÿï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯CTRL +C ã€‚æ‰§è¡Œä¸Šè¿°ä»£ç æ—¶ï¼ŒæŒ‰ä¸‹CTRL + C åç¨‹åºæ²¡æœ‰ååº”ã€‚
å¦‚æœæˆ‘ä»¬æƒ³ç»“æŸè¯¥ç¨‹åºå¯ä»¥æŒ‰ä¸‹CTRL +\ï¼ŒCTRL +\ ç»„åˆé”®ä¼šäº§ç”ŸSIGQUITä¿¡å·ï¼Œæ­¤ä¿¡å·å¹¶æ²¡æœ‰è¢«å¿½ç•¥ã€‚

2.3è‡ªå®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°

void (*signal(int sig, void (*func)(int)))(int);

ç¬¬äºŒå‚æ•°ä¸º å‡½æ•°æŒ‡é’ˆ ï¼šå½“signalå‡½æ•°æ•è·ä¿¡å·åï¼Œé€šè¿‡æŒ‡å®šå‡½æ•°è¿›è¡Œå¤„ç†ã€‚
æ­¤å‡½æ•°å¿…é¡»åœ¨ signal() è¢«è°ƒç”¨å‰ç”³æ˜ã€‚

#include <chrono>
#include <iostream>
#include <csignal>
#include <thread>

using namespace std;

using namespace std;
void signalHandler( int signum ) {
    std::cout << "æˆ‘æ¥å¤„ç†ï¼" << std::endl;
    std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::seconds(5));
}

int main() {
    
    signal(SIGINT, signalHandler);			// æ•è· SIGINT
    std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::seconds(2));
        
    std::cout << "ç¨‹åºç»“æŸ." << endl;
    
    return 0;
}

è¯¥ç¨‹åºå£°æ˜äº†ä¿¡å·ç±»å‹ä¸º SIGINT çš„signalå‡½æ•°ï¼Œç”¨äºæ•è· SIGINTä¿¡å·ã€‚SIGINTä¿¡å·ä»£è¡¨ç”±InterruptKeyäº§ç”Ÿï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯CTRL +C
å½“ä»€ä¹ˆéƒ½ä¸åšæ—¶ï¼Œç¨‹åºä¼šæ­£å¸¸è¿è¡Œåˆ°ç»“æŸã€‚
å¦‚æœåœ¨ç¨‹åºç»“æŸå‰æŒ‰ä¸‹CTRL +C ï¼Œå‡½æ•°æ•è·SIGINTä¿¡å·ï¼Œè¿›å…¥signalHandlerå‡½æ•°ï¼Œmianå‡½æ•°é˜»å¡ï¼Œç›´è‡³signalHandlerå‡½æ•°è¿è¡Œç»“æŸï¼Œmianå‡½æ•°æ‰“å°åç¨‹åºç»“æŸã€‚

3.å‡½æ•°raise

å‡½æ•°raise äº§ç”Ÿä¸€ä¸ªä¿¡å·sigï¼Œå¹¶å‘å½“å‰æ­£åœ¨æ‰§è¡Œçš„ç¨‹åºå‘é€ä¿¡å·sigï¼Œå…¶å£°æ˜å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

int raise (int sig);

é‡ç‚¹ï¼š å€¼å¾—æ³¨æ„çš„æ˜¯ï¼Œraiseå‘å‡ºçš„ä¿¡å·ï¼Œå¯è¢«å½“å‰è¿›ç¨‹ä¸­åŒç±»å‹å‹å·çš„signalå‡½æ•°æ•è·ã€‚

#include <chrono>
#include <iostream>
#include <csignal>
#include <thread>

using namespace std;
void signalHandler( int signum ) {
    std::cout << "æˆ‘æ¥å¤„ç†ï¼" << std::endl;
    std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::seconds(2));
    
    raise(SIGQUIT);                     // 3. é€€å‡ºç¨‹åº
}

int main() {
    
    signal(SIGINT, signalHandler);      // 1. signalå‡½æ•°ï¼Œç”¨äºæ•è· SIGINT ä¿¡å·
    int i=0;

    while(++i){
        std::cout << "keep run...." << i << std::endl;
        if( i == 3 )
            raise(SIGINT);              // 2. raise, å‘é€SIGINT ä¿¡å·
    }
    
    return 0;
}

å¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡ºå½“signalæ•è·ä¿¡å·åï¼Œmainå‡½æ•°å¯¹åº”çš„ç¨‹åºæš‚åœï¼Œä¸å†æ‰“å°ã€‚
æœ¬æµ‹è¯•ä¸­signalHandler()å‘å‡º SIGQUITä¿¡å·ï¼Œè¿›ç¨‹ç»“æŸã€‚

å‚è€ƒåšå®¢https://blog.csdn.net/u013271656/article/details/114537411

entry.title: hexo-startup
entry.content:
Hexoå…¥é—¨

ç®€ä»‹
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

Create a new post

$ hexo new "My New Post"

More info: Writing

Run server

$ hexo server

More info: Server

Generate static files

$ hexo generate

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

$ hexo deploy

More info: Deployment
